content.description: Thin adequately describes this problem.  So unless you have mutant fingers, use thine feet well. Start on the rail just left of the roof on north face.  Reach directly up to the thin sloping rail.  Grab and use this and only this thin rail to it's terminous.  Yes yes!
content.protection: A pad and a spot is nice.  An ankle biter lies above the first couple of moves.

content.description: Meditation Boulder is downhill and right from the Eliminator Boulder, perhaps 30 yards.  This problem, to traverse the entire problem, no holds eliminated, is a great moderate problem.  Most traverse starting on the easy East side fof the South Face and traverse counterclockwise around the boulder.  Teaches one how to use one's feet, shake out after a pump, and packs in the moves.  Among the separate cruxes divided by rests, in order one will encounter, are the thin crimp rail of the east face, the odd sloping (if one stays low) moves and seam of the north face, the technically complicated west face which becomes easier and easier as one wires the moves and learns the intricate balance, plus the final powerful traverse above the [south] roof.
content.protection: Essentially a safe traverse if one stays low and within one's abilities.  A few areas could use a spot, stay lower on the east and north faces.

content.description: Start with two hand holds above roof with feet under roof. Go left to an edge and then to the horizontal crack. Two more jugs complete the problem.
content.protection: Pads over the pointed rock near the base (learned the hard way).
content.location: South face of Meditation Boulder. Can't miss it.

content.description: The only difference between this and the standard meditation traverse is the requirement to stay low through the roof on the north side of this boulder.  Usually this section is the last climbed, so ones shakes off the initially pump at the jugs on the NW corner before attacking the final crux moves below the roof.  After you have it wired, do laps or work it in reverse or try Tommy's Way.
content.protection: Lowball, pad or spotter not required, but always nice.

content.description:
A fun eliminate version of the meditation low traverse.  Showed this to my partner Chris, who then worked it out and passed the beta to me.  Left of the roof on the south face of Meditation boulder is a series of three of four holds at chest level which the standard

Meditation Low Traverse

follow.  Below the last at belly button (depending) level is a dish just before the roof.  Start with hands matched on this hold.  The only hands one is allowed under the roof are the mono pocket and junky edge / crimp to its right.  Get onto these and then shoot for the jug at the right of the pod / roof.  Control and match here and then climb easily up and right.  Short, thin and fun.  I found this as hard as

Tommy's Way

just above. Like that line, easier when cooler. The grade may be debate-able, as they all are.
content.protection: Nice landing for this low traverse, a spot is nice to keep butt clean.

content.description:
This is a bit of a silly eliminate. Start on the jugs at the far left side of the south face of the boulder. Stay low till you get to the roof, then throw to the crimp right above the left edge of the roof. Bump over and use both right-facing sidepulls to get up to the rail, and finish on the end of

Gastoned Direct

.
content.protection:
Place your crash pad where you would for

Gastoned Direct

, as it's the first place where you get above 3 feet off the ground.
content.location: The first jug is just right of the southwest corner of the boulder, about 3-4 feet above the ground.

content.description:
A silly eliminate on the

Meditation Roof

.  Start on the jug at the lower right lip of the roof (the finishing hold for left to right low traverse).  Shoot four feet left to the edge (a finger pad thick and at least four inches wide) above the lip of the roof.  Match.  Fire straight up to the good incut, but small edge (once again about a pad thick) about a foot above the seam (

Tommy's Way

). Top out.
content.protection: A pad and spotter are nice but not needed.

content.description: Start on the two jugs on the right side of the overhang, and shoot straight up to the left hand, intermediate crimp. Get a high right foot, and hit for the horizontal rail. Make a big move to the top. Fun!
Start on the jug on the right side of the overhang and fire left to the namesake gaston. Then cross over with your right, and pull the roof. Continue up and left to the top of the boulder.
content.location: This starts on the jug on the right side of the obvious roof on the south side of the Meditation Boulder.

content.description: Ludicrous warning...a fun line but a little silly.  Find the roof on meditation boulder (south side). 'Grab' the two smears of underclings under the south roof of meditation boulder.  Now it's essentially only two moves.  1) Crank your feet onto the rock. 2) Grab any hold above the roof.  Top it out now that you've got it.

content.protection: A pad and a spotter are nice to have on this but are not necessary.
